alert.note: Alert for Coastal North Bay Including Point Reyes National Seashore; East Bay Hills; East Bay Interior Valleys; Marin Coastal Range; North Bay Interior Mountains; North Bay Interior Valleys; San Francisco; San Francisco Bay Shoreline; San Fransisco Peninsula Coast (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 10 at 2:17AM PST by NWS Monterey
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Marin, Alameda, northern San Mateo, Contra Costa, southeastern Sonoma, San Francisco, northwestern Santa Clara and Napa Counties through 245 AM PST... At 216 AM PST, Doppler radar was tracking a line of strong thunderstorms moving through the San Francisco Bay Area. Movement was northeast at 65 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... San Jose, San Francisco, Oakland, Fremont, Santa Rosa, Hayward, Sunnyvale, Concord, Santa Clara, Berkeley, Richmond, Antioch, Daly City, San Mateo, San Leandro, Livermore, Napa, Redwood City, Mountain View and Alameda. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
